definition: big/stream or canal/drain/ditch/CL:條|条[tiao2]/him (dialect)/outer rim of a carriage wheel (old)

sentences.english: The soil sample came from a trench approximately 2 inches deep.
sentences.chinese: 土壤標本來自於一個大概2寸深的溝渠。

sentences.english: She is Hongjiadu rural customs of the mother of all drains.
sentences.chinese: 她是洪家關鄉所有溝渠的母親。

sentences.english: She helped clear ditches and even went door to door offering well-cleaning for free.
sentences.chinese: 她幫助清理溝渠，甚至挨家挨戶免費爲大家清理水井。

sentences.english: The stream of truth flows though its channels of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 真理的細流沿着謬誤的溝渠川流而過。

sentences.english: The fields are crisscrossed by irrigation canals and ditches.
sentences.chinese: 這裏溝渠相連，灌溉系統十分發達。

sentences.english: Thesoldiers and the police crouched in irrigation ditches and behind walls.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們和警察們蹲下來清洗溝渠和圍牆。

sentences.english: This aqueduct of the sewer is formidable; it interlaces in a dizzy fashion.
sentences.chinese: 這個污水溝渠實在太可怕，它的交叉使人暈眩。

sentences.english: I had the heart to the moon, but the moon shines on the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 本人本將心向明月，奈何明月照溝渠。

sentences.english: To dig an uncrossable river for the one who loves you.
sentences.chinese: 對你的愛人，掘了一條無法跨越的溝渠。

sentences.english: The running water eroded a gully.
Using drainage canals in combined system to treat sewage is a new technology.
sentences.chinese: 利用合流制排水溝渠處理污水是一項新技術。

sentences.english: They cut a channel from the river to bring water to the field.
sentences.chinese: 他們從河那裏挖了條溝渠把水引到地裏。

sentences.english: Still have to clean up the drains a bit more and a few more putty bits and light sanding to do.
sentences.chinese: 仍然要清理溝渠多一點和多幾個膩子位和輕砂做的。

sentences.english: Aqueducts and ponds were recognized as habitats with highest invasion ratio.
sentences.chinese: 溝渠與埤塘是入侵種比率最高的生育地類型。

sentences.english: Controlled flooding may be accomplished from field ditches or by use of borders, checks, or basins.
sentences.chinese: 有控制的滿灌可以通過溝渠，槽口和盆地進行引導。

definition: lit. windswept and battered by rain/to undergo hardship (idiom)
to collect water/to be covered with water/to pond/accumulated water/ponding
to water the plants/to water the garden
